alert.note: Alert for Clay; Craighead; Greene; Mississippi; Poinsett (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued October 13 at 9:03AM CDT until October 14 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...RED FLAG CONDITIONS EXPECTED THURSDAY AFTERNOON OVER PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST ARKANSAS, THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL, AND WEST TENNESSEE... .A combination of gusty northwest to north 20 ft winds, low relative humidity values between 20 to 25 percent, 10 hour fuel moisture values below 10 percent will result in Red Flag conditions over portions of Northeast Arkansas, the Missouri Bootheel, and West Tennessee on Thursday. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS...LOW HUMIDITY... AND LOW FUEL MOISTURE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS...LOW HUMIDITY...AND LOW FUEL MOISTURE... The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * WIND...20 foot winds between 12 to 20 mph. * HUMIDITY...relative humidity values below 25 percent. * 10 HOUR FUEL MOISTURE...10 percent or less * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
